intro: Hieracium dollineri subsp. tephropolioides, commonly known as the Tephropolioides hawkweed, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically features hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. It thrives in calcareous grasslands and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
